title: fix misplaced space in German translation
Update the French translation
body:
- Renumbering of the misaligned translation strings
- Translation of 2 missing strings
- Correction of a few typos and punctuation/capitalisation errors

title: Update Japanese translation
body:
- Add Japanese translations for `src/help.rs`, etc.
- Change some existing translations because it was different from [pacman's](https://gitlab.archlinux.org/pacman/pacman/-/blob/master/src/pacman/po/ja.po).

title: [Minor] Make upgrade text bold (to match pacman)
body:
When running commands like `pacman -Qu`, pacman prints the upgrade text in green and bold, while paru currently only prints it in green. This very very minor commit fixes that disparity.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24192522/129461415-90c87087-4836-46be-b923-45025dc72048.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24192522/129461424-310370a3-55ec-4450-acd9-272e77cc0176.png)

title: Update pt_BR translation
body: Some suggestions for the Portuguese translation.

title: Add zh_TW translations.
body: I added zh_TW translations, please review and merge it :smiley:

title: Improve error message for failing makepkg command
body:
related to #491.

callers of `makepkg_output` never actually provide `--verifysource -Ccf`, but rather `--printsrcinfo` or `--packagelist`

Print the actual `args` instead.

title: nl_NL: Add missing whitespace in translation
body:
I currently have some local-only packages installed and the dutch (nl_NL) translation for it lacks a space and colon.

![afbeelding](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/981494/128415023-595972d4-0d78-4b1b-bc1d-ee119be96ba3.png)

title: use active form for german strings, instead of passive
Fix '-r' and '-b' crashing paru
body: The short global pacman flags were not using the given value resulting in paru setting the respective paths to an empty string which caused a `error: failed to initialize alpm: root=/ dbpath=: could not find or read directory` crash.

title: update paru.8 & paru.conf.5 to suppress troff warning
body:
When running `man paru > /dev/null` or `man paru.conf > /dev/null`, the system reports
```
troff: <standard input>:1: name expected (got '\ '): treated as missing
```
The culprit appears to be the first line in the paru.8 & paru.conf.5 files. This PR fixes this problem.

title: Fix various problems in the French translation
Add fr translation
body: Translated all the strings to french but some might need tweaking
